Class Util

java.lang.Object
edu.touro.mco152.bm.Util
public class Util extends Object
Utility class providing common helper methods to jDiskMark.

This class includes reusable functions for generating, analyzing, and validating data, file operations, random number generation, and specific disk information retrieval. Including other support tasks essential to the benchmarking process.

  • Method Details

    • deleteDirectory

      public static boolean deleteDirectory(File path)
      Deletes the Directory and all files within
      Parameters:
      path - Directory to delete
      Returns:
      True if path deleted successfully

    • randInt

      public static int randInt(int min, int max)
      Returns a pseudo-random number between min and max, inclusive. The difference between min and max can be at most Integer.MAX_VALUE - 1.
      Parameters:
      min - Minimum value
      max - Maximum value. Must be greater than min.
      Returns:
      Integer between min and max, inclusive.
      See Also:
      • Random.nextInt(int)

    • displayString

      public static String displayString(double num)

    • getDiskInfo

      public static String getDiskInfo(File dataDir)
      Get OS specific disk info based on the drive the path is mapped to.
      Parameters:
      dataDir - the data directory being used in the run.
      Returns:
      Disk info if available.

    • getModelFromLetter2

      public static String getModelFromLetter2(String driveLetter)
      Get the drive model description based on the windows drive letter. Uses the powershell script disk-model.ps1

      Parses output such as the following:

      DiskModel DriveLetter --------- ----------- ST31500341AS ATA Device D: Samsung SSD 850 EVO 1TB ATA Device C:

      Tested on Windows 10 on 3/6/2017

      Parameters:
      driveLetter - The windows drive letter whose model will be returned
      Returns:
      A string describing disk model, or a default "Unknown" description

    • getDeviceFromPath

      public static String getDeviceFromPath(Path path)
      On Linux OS get the device path when given a file path. eg. filePath = /home/james/Desktop/jDiskMarkData devicePath = /dev/sda
      Parameters:
      path - the file path
      Returns:
      the device path

    • getDeviceModel

      public static String getDeviceModel(String devicePath)
      On Linux OS use the lsblk command to get the disk model number for a specific Device i.e. /dev/sda
      Parameters:
      devicePath - path of the device
      Returns:
      the disk model number

    • getDeviceSize

      public static String getDeviceSize(String devicePath)
      On Linux OS use the lsblk command to get the disk size for a specific Device i.e. /dev/sda
      Parameters:
      devicePath - path of the device
      Returns:
      the size of the device
